column2: Then he dimmed the lights, indicating that for the moment there was nothing more to be said.
column3: Then he dimmed the lights, indicating that for the moment there was nothing more to be said.

column2: Just then his father, face very gray and very old, entered the room of the Master Beryl from the laboratory.
column3: Just then his father, face very gray and very old, entered the room of the Master Beryl from the laboratory.

column2: Son! he said.
column3: Son! he said.

column2: The crisis is almost upon us!	The crisis is almost upon us!
column3: false

column2: The Martians are coming!"
column3: The Martians are coming!"

column2: CHAPTER XXI
column3: CHAPTER twenty one

column2: _Cubes of Chaos_
column3: underscore Cubes of Chaos underscore

column2: Sarka raced into the Observatory, wondering as he ran how the attack of the Martians would manifest itself; but scarcely prepared for the brilliant display which greeted his gaze.
column3: Sarka raced into the Observatory, wondering as he ran how the attack of the Martians would manifest itself; but scarcely prepared for the brilliant display which greeted his gaze.

column2: Compared to the oncoming flames from Mars, the preceding display of lights had been as nothing. The whole Heavens between the Earth and Mars seemed alight with an unearthly glare, as though the very heart of the sun had burst and hurled part of its flaming mass outward into space.
column3: Compared to the oncoming flames from Mars, the preceding display of lights had been as nothing. The whole Heavens between the Earth and Mars seemed alight with an unearthly glare, as though the very heart of the sun had burst and hurled part of its flaming mass outward into space.

column2: On it came with unbelievable speed.
column3: On it came with unbelievable speed.

column2: But there was no telling, yet, the form of the things which were coming.
column3: But there was no telling, yet, the form of the things which were coming.

column2: What are they? whispered Jaska, standing fearlessly at Sarka's side. "Interplanetary cars?
column3: What are they? whispered Jaska, standing fearlessly at Sarka's side. "Interplanetary cars?

column2: Rockets?
column3: Rockets?

column2: Balls of fire?
column3: Balls of fire?

column2: Or beings of Mars?"
column3: Or beings of Mars?"

column2: I think, said Sarka, after studying the display for a few minutes, "that they are either rockets or fireballs, perhaps both together!
column3: I think, said Sarka, after studying the display for a few minutes, "that they are either rockets or fireballs, perhaps both together!

column2: But the Martians cannot consolidate any position on the Earth without coming to handgrips.
column3: But the Martians cannot consolidate any position on the Earth without coming to handgrips.

column2: Since they must know this, we can expect to see the people of Mars themselves when, or soon after, those balls of fire strike the Earth!"
column3: Since they must know this, we can expect to see the people of Mars themselves when, or soon after, those balls of fire strike the Earth!"

column2: Sarka raced back to the room of the Master Beryl as a strident humming came through to him.
column3: Sarka raced back to the room of the Master Beryl as a strident humming came through to him.

column2: The Spokesmen of the Gens whose borders touched those of the devasted Dalis area, were reporting again, and their voices were high pitched with fear that threatened to break the bounds of sanity.
column3: The Spokesmen of the Gens whose borders touched those of the devasted Dalis area, were reporting again, and their voices were high pitched with fear that threatened to break the bounds of sanity.

column2: The ferment in the devasted area, was the gist of their report, "is assuming myriads of shapes!
column3: The ferment in the devasted area, was the gist of their report, "is assuming myriads of shapes!

column2: The fused mass has broken up into isolated masses, and each mass of itself is assuming one of the many forms!"
column3: The fused mass has broken up into isolated masses, and each mass of itself is assuming one of the many forms!"

column2: What forms? snapped Sarka.
column3: What forms? snapped Sarka.

column2: Quickly!
column3: Quickly!

column2: Cubes!	Cubes!
column3: true

column2: Thousands and millions of cubes, and the cubes themselves are forming into larger cubes, some square, some rectangular!
column3: Thousands and millions of cubes, and the cubes themselves are forming into larger cubes, some square, some rectangular!

column2: In the midst of these formations are others, mostly columnar, each column consisting of cubes which have coalesced into the larger form from the same small cubes!
column3: In the midst of these formations are others, mostly columnar, each column consisting of cubes which have coalesced into the larger form from the same small cubes!

column2: The columnar formations are topped by globes which emit an ethereal radiance!"
column3: The columnar formations are topped by globes which emit an ethereal radiance!"

column2: Listen! Sarka's voice was vibrant with excitement.
column3: Listen! Sarka's voice was vibrant with excitement.

column2: Spokesmen of the Gens, make sure that every individual member of your Gens is fully equipped with flying clothing including belts and ovoids--prepared for an indefinite stay outside on the roof of the world!	Spokesmen of the Gens, make sure that every individual member of your Gens is fully equipped with flying clothing including belts and ovoids-prepared for an indefinite stay outside on the roof of the world!
column3: true

column2: Get your people out swiftly, keeping them in formation!
column3: Get your people out swiftly, keeping them in formation!

column2: Keep about you those people of Dalis whom I sent you, and understand before you break contact with your Beryls, that instructions received from these people come from me!
column3: Keep about you those people of Dalis whom I sent you, and understand before you break contact with your Beryls, that instructions received from these people come from me!

column2: In turn, after you have quitted the hives, anything you wish to say to me you can repeat to any one of the glowing people of Dalis!"
column3: In turn, after you have quitted the hives, anything you wish to say to me you can repeat to any one of the glowing people of Dalis!"

column2: The contacts were broken.
column3: The contacts were broken.

column2: Sarka stared into the Beryl, glancing swiftly in all directions, to see whether his orders were obeyed.
column3: Sarka stared into the Beryl, glancing swiftly in all directions, to see whether his orders were obeyed.

column2: Out of the myriads of hives were flying the people of all the Gens of Earth, their vast numbers already darkening the roof of the world.
column3: Out of the myriads of hives were flying the people of all the Gens of Earth, their vast numbers already darkening the roof of the world.

column2: The advance fires from Mars seemed to have no effect on them, which Sarka had expected, since the fires seemed to consume nothing they had touched previously.
column3: The advance fires from Mars seemed to have no effect on them, which Sarka had expected, since the fires seemed to consume nothing they had touched previously.

column2: By millions the people came forth.
column3: By millions the people came forth.

column2: People dressed in the clothing of this Gens or that, wearing each the insignia of the house of his Spokesman.
column3: People dressed in the clothing of this Gens or that, wearing each the insignia of the house of his Spokesman.

column2: A brave show.
column3: A brave show.

column2: Sarka could see the faces of many, now in light, now in shadow, as the advance fires of Mars lighted them for a moment in passing, then left them in shadow as the bursting balls of fire faded and died.
column3: Sarka could see the faces of many, now in light, now in shadow, as the advance fires of Mars lighted them for a moment in passing, then left them in shadow as the bursting balls of fire faded and died.

column2: Strange, too, that the fireballs made no noise.
column3: Strange, too, that the fireballs made no noise.

column2: Noiseless flame which rebounded from the surface of the Earth broke in silence, deluging the heavens with shooting stars of great brilliance.
column3: Noiseless flame which rebounded from the surface of the Earth broke in silence, deluging the heavens with shooting stars of great brilliance.

column2: Through its display flew the people of the Gens, mustering in flight above flight, each to his own level, under command of the Spokesmen of the Gens.
column3: Through its display flew the people of the Gens, mustering in flight above flight, each to his own level, under command of the Spokesmen of the Gens.

column2: How long, father, queried Sarka, "should it take to empty the Gens areas?"
column3: How long, father, queried Sarka, "should it take to empty the Gens areas?"

column2: The people of Earth have been waiting for word to go into battle since we first sent the people of Dalis against the Moon-men.	The people of Earth have been waiting for word to go into battle since we first sent the people of Dalis against the Moon men.
column3: true

column2: They still are ready!
column3: They still are ready!

column2: The dwellings of our people, _all_ of them, can be emptied within an hour!"
column3: The dwellings of our people, underscore all underscore of them, can be emptied within an hour!"

column2: I wonder, mused Sarka, "if that is soon enough!"
column3: I wonder, mused Sarka, "if that is soon enough!"

column2: Perhaps yes, perhaps no.
column3: Perhaps yes, perhaps no

column2: It would be a race, in any case.
column3: It would be a race, in any case.

column2: Sarka divided his attention between the rapidly changing formations of the Moon-cubes in that devasted area and the onrushing charge of the fire-balls from Mars.
column3: Sarka divided his attention between the rapidly changing formations of the Moon cubes in that devasted area and the onrushing charge of the fire balls from Mars.

column2: All were visible to him through the Master Beryl, and from the Observatory, though the Martian fire-balls were now so close that the vanguard of them could even be seen in the Master Beryl, adjusted to view only activities on the surface of the Earth.
column3: All were visible to him through the Master Beryl, and from the Observatory, though the Martian fire balls were now so close that the vanguard of them could even be seen in the Master Beryl, adjusted to view only activities on the surface of the Earth.

column2: Even as the last flights of the Gens of Earth were slipping into the icy air from the roof of the world, the Moon-cubes began their terrifying, appalling attack, every detail of which could be seen by Sarka from the Master Beryl.
column3: Even as the last flights of the Gens of Earth were slipping into the icy air from the roof of the world, the Moon cubes began their terrifying, appalling attack, every detail of which could be seen by Sarka from the Master Beryl.

column2: Those columns, composed of cubes, seemed to be the leaders of a vast cube-army.
column3: Those columns, composed of cubes, seemed to be the leaders of a vast cube army.

column2: The top of each of them was a gleaming globe whose eery light played over the country immediately surrounding each column, their weird light reflected in the squares, rectangles and globes that other cubes had formed.
column3: The top of each of them was a gleaming globe whose eery light played over the country immediately surrounding each column, their weird light reflected in the squares, rectangles and globes that other cubes had formed.

column2: Sarka sought swiftly among the columns for the one which might conceivably be in supreme command; but even as he sought the Moon-cubes moved to the attack.
column3: Sarka sought swiftly among the columns for the one which might conceivably be in supreme command; but even as he sought the Moon cubes moved to the attack.

column2: The globes on the tops of the columns dimmed their lights, and the squares, rectangles and globes got instantly into terrible motion.
column3: The globes on the tops of the columns dimmed their lights, and the squares, rectangles and globes got instantly into terrible motion.

column2: Southward from the position in which they had formed they began to move, the squares and rectangles apparently sliding along the surface of the scarred and broken soil, the globes rolling.
column3: Southward from the position in which they had formed they began to move, the squares and rectangles apparently sliding along the surface of the scarred and broken soil, the globes rolling.

column2: Southward there was the vast wall of the Gens that bordered the devasted area in that direction, and the cube-army was instantly at full charge toward this, in what Sarka realized was, to be a war of demolition!
column3: Southward there was the vast wall of the Gens that bordered the devasted area in that direction, and the cube army was instantly at full charge toward this, in what Sarka realized was, to be a war of demolition!

column2: Within a minute, Sarka was conscious of a trembling of all the laboratory, and the eyes of Jaska were wide with fear.
column3: Within a minute, Sarka was conscious of a trembling of all the laboratory, and the eyes of Jaska were wide with fear.

column2: Swiftly the trembling grew, until sound now was added to the vast, awesome tremor--a vast, roaring crescendo of sound that mounted and mounted as the speed of the cube-army increased.
column3: Swiftly the trembling grew, until sound now was added to the vast, awesome tremor-a vast, roaring crescendo of sound that mounted and mounted as the speed of the cube army increased.

column2: The vanguard of the cube-army struck the dwelling of the Gens southward of that of Dalis, and a mighty, rocketing roar sounded in the Master Beryl, was audible inside the laboratory, even without the aid of the Beryl, at whose surface Sarka stared as a man fascinated, hypnotized.
column3: The vanguard of the cube army struck the dwelling of the Gens southward of that of Dalis, and a mighty, rocketing roar sounded in the Master Beryl, was audible inside the laboratory, even without the aid of the Beryl, at whose surface Sarka stared as a man fascinated, hypnotized.

column2: The cube-army struck the dwellings, disappeared into them as though they had been composed of tissue paper, and continued on!
column3: The cube army struck the dwellings, disappeared into them as though they had been composed of tissue paper, and continued on!

column2: Over the tops of the cube-army toppled the roofs of the dwellings, there, in the midst of the cubes, to be ground to powder, with a sound as of a million avalanches grinding together in some awesome, sun-size valley. Southward, in the wake of the chaotic charge, moved a mighty, gigantic crevasse, whose sides were the walls of the hives left standing.
column3: Over the tops of the cube army toppled the roofs of the dwellings, there, in the midst of the cubes, to be ground to powder, with a sound as of a million avalanches grinding together in some awesome, sun size valley. Southward, in the wake of the chaotic charge, moved a mighty, gigantic crevasse, whose sides were the walls of the hives left standing.

column2: And still the cube-army moved in, grinding everything it touched to dust, trampling buildings into nothingness, destroying utterly along a front hundreds of miles wide, and as deep as the dwellings of men!
column3: And still the cube army moved in, grinding everything it touched to dust, trampling buildings into nothingness, destroying utterly along a front hundreds of miles wide, and as deep as the dwellings of men!

column2: God! cried Sarka, his voice so tense that both his father and Jaska heard it above the roaring which shook and rocked the world.
column3: God! cried Sarka, his voice so tense that both his father and Jaska heard it above the roaring which shook and rocked the world.

column2: Do you see?	Do you see?
column3: true

column2: The Moon-cubes are destroying the dwelling of our people, and the Martians are to destroy the people who have fled!"
column3: The Moon cubes are destroying the dwelling of our people, and the Martians are to destroy the people who have fled!"

column2: There must be a way, said Sarka the Second quietly, "to circumvent the cubes!
column3: There must be a way, said Sarka the Second quietly, "to circumvent the cubes!

column2: But what?
column3: But what?

column2: Your will still rules the cubes which piloted you from the Moon?"
column3: Your will still rules the cubes which piloted you from the Moon?"

column2: Yes, replied Sarka tersely, "but there are only a dozen of the cubes. What can they do against countless millions of them?
column3: Yes, replied Sarka tersely, "but there are only a dozen of the cubes. What can they do against countless millions of them?

column2: Cubes which are Moon-cubes, brought to the Earth in the heart of that blue column, here reformed to create an army which is invincible, because it cannot be slain!
column3: Cubes which are Moon cubes, brought to the Earth in the heart of that blue column, here reformed to create an army which is invincible, because it cannot be slain!

column2: It means that the Moon-people themselves, thousands of miles out of our reach, have but to sit in comfort and watch their cube-slaves destroy us!
column3: It means that the Moon people themselves, thousands of miles out of our reach, have but to sit in comfort and watch their cube slaves destroy us!

column2: When they have laid waste the Earth, the Martians have but to finish the fight!"
column3: When they have laid waste the Earth, the Martians have but to finish the fight!"

column2: If, beloved, said Jaska, "your will commands those twelve cubes, it can also command all the others, for they must be essentially the same. Call on the rebels of Dalis to help you!"
column3: If, beloved, said Jaska, "your will commands those twelve cubes, it can also command all the others, for they must be essentially the same. Call on the rebels of Dalis to help you!"

column2: Then what of the Spokesmen of the Gens, who will be out of contact with me?
column3: Then what of the Spokesmen of the Gens, who will be out of contact with me?

column2: They must stand on their own feet, must fight their own battle!	They must stand on their own feet, must fight their own battle!
column3: true

column2: Call to you the people who have passed through the white flames, and fight with the distant will of Luar and of Dalis for control of the cube-army!"
column3: Call to you the people who have passed through the white flames, and fight with the distant will of Luar and of Dalis for control of the cube army!"

column2: Again that exaltation, which convinced him he could move mountains with his two hands, coursed through the being of Sarka.
column3: Again that exaltation, which convinced him he could move mountains with his two hands, coursed through the being of Sarka.

column2: Quietly be answered Jaska.
column3: Quietly be answered Jaska.

column2: I believe you are right, he said softly.
column3: I believe you are right, he said softly.

column2: Those of us who have passed through the flames which bore these Moon-cubes will control the cubes, even bend them to our will.	Those of us who have passed through the flames which bore these Moon cubes will control the cubes, even bend them to our will.
column3: true

column2: The Spokesmen must vanquish the Martians or perish!"
column3: The Spokesmen must vanquish the Martians or perish!"

column2: Then he sent his mental commands to the Spokesmen:
column3: Then he sent his mental commands to the Spokesmen:

column2: Meet the Martians when they arrive and destroy or drive them back!	Meet the Martians when they arrive and destroy or drive them back!
column3: true

column2: You live only if you win!
column3: You live only if you win!

column2: We speak no more until victory is ours!
column3: We speak no more until victory is ours!

column2: People of the Gens of Dalis, go to the areas being devasted by the cubes, taking your cubes and aircars with you, and I will join you there!
column3: People of the Gens of Dalis, go to the areas being devasted by the cubes, taking your cubes and aircars with you, and I will join you there!

column2: _And Jaska with me!_"
column3: underscore And Jaska with me!underscore"

column2: Sarka had not himself mentally spoken the last four words.
column3: Sarka had not himself mentally spoken the last four words.

column2: Jaska had thought-spoken them, before he could prevent.
column3: Jaska had thought spoken them, before he could prevent.

column2: He turned upon her, lips shaping a command that she remain behind.
column3: He turned upon her, lips shaping a command that she remain behind.

column2: But she forestalled him.
column3: But she forestalled him.

column2: I, too, have been through the white flames!	I, too, have been through the white flames!
column3: true

column2: You may have need of all of us!"
column3: You may have need of all of us!"
